title: Bead Purification 1 & 2
author: Opentrons
description:
This protocol performs an identical Bead Purification assay consecutively in the same run. The protocol allows for the user to input the number of samples (up to 96) to process. For reagent setup, see 'Additional Notes' below.

You will need:
 P50 Sinlge-channel Pipette
 P300 Multi-channel Pipette
 FrameStar® Break-A-Way PCR Plates, Low Profile
 Magnetic Module
 4-in-1 Tube Rack Set
 12-well Trough
* Opentrons 300 ul Tip Racks
process:
Input the number of samples you would like process (MAX = 96).
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol into the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map.
Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support article.
Hit "Run".
15 uL SPRI beads are distributed to each sample, which is pre-loaded in a 96-well PCR plate on the Magnetic Module.
After an incubation of 5 minutes, the Magnetic Module will engage for 5 minutes to allow the beads to settle.
While the Magnetic Module is being engaged, 34 uL of the supernatant (34 of 40 total) is discarded.
Samples are washed with 80% Ethanol twice, then allowed to air-dry for 5 minutes.
Samples are resuspended with 30 uL elution buffer.
After an incubation of 3 minutes, the Magnetic Module will engage for 1 minutes to allow the beads to settle.
25 uL of the supernatant is transferred and mixed into a clean PCR plate in slot 1.
Robot pauses and allows user to perform PCR2 on a thermocycler. Once it is completed, user can resume the protocol and allow the samples to go through a second round of bead purification (repeats steps 7-14).
notes:
Trough 12-row Setup:
 A1: 80% Ethanol
 A2: 80% Ethanol
 A3: Elution Buffer for Bead Purification 1
 A4: Elution Buffer for Bead Purification 2

4x6 1.5-mL Eppendorf Tube Rack Setup:
* A1: SPRI Beads

If you have any questions about this protocol, please contact protocols@opentrons.com.
